register.description: Second address map for register. Used only by automatic restore upon wakeup from device OFF mode.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the L3_1_GICLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is ongoing

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3_1 clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.

register.description: Second address map for register. Used only by automatic restore upon wakeup from device OFF mode.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: Second address map for register. Used only by automatic restore upon wakeup from device OFF mode.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: Second address map for register. Used only by automatic restore upon wakeup from device OFF mode.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is disabled and cannot be accessed
Module is in idle mode (only Interconnect part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is fully functional, including Interconnect

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any Interconnect access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: Second address map for register. Used only by automatic restore upon wakeup from device OFF mode. [warm reset insensitive]

bitfield.description: Module idle status

bitenum.description: Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disabled by software. OCP configuration port is not accessible.
Module is managed automatically by hardware along with L3INSTR domain.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by hardware according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If CLKTRCTRL=3, any INTRCONN access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: Second address map for register CM_L3INIT_USB_HOST_CLKCTRL. Used only by automatic restore upon wakeup from device OFF mode.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock for UTMI Port2 on USB Host

bitenum.description: The functional clock is provided by the internal clock source
The functional clock is provided by an external PHY through an I/O pad.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock for UTMI Por1 on USB Host

bitenum.description: The functional clock is provided by the internal clock source
The functional clock is provided by an external PHY through an I/O pad.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]
Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB-HOST optional clock control: FUNC48MCLK
USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC480M_P2_CLK
USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC480M_P1_CLK
USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC60M_P2_CLK
USB-HOST optional clock control: HSIC60M_P1_CLK
USB-HOST optional clock control: UTMI_P3_CLK
USB-HOST optional clock control: UTMI_P2_CLK when CLKSEL_UTMI_P2 is 0
USB-HOST optional clock control: UTMI_P1_CLK when CLKSEL_UTMI_P1 is 0
SAR mode control for the module. Shall not be modify except if module is disabled.
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by software. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.
